review: I've never been to Red Robin before, and I've already been here TWICE this year.  It's such a fun place to be at, and [most] of the servers are nice.  Great place to have a beer, and not feel bad if there are kids at your table.  Burgers and fried seafood are good here.  Specific bottomless drinks, including root beer floats (yum!) Fun environment - not much to complain about.

The host was too busy chatting with coworkers and looking at his cellphone to seat us right away. We waited 10 minutes for a server. She was very nice but then we didn't see her again till the food came, then not again till we got the bill.

when i went there somebody showed us to our table the we sat and waited for five minutes before calling over a sever to ask where our waiter/water was. apparently we didn't have a waiter. then there was some more confusion and waiting until a waiter came. also our sodas/milkshakes were delayed, on the other hand, the burgers and milkshakes were good.

If I wrote this review based on my last meal at this Red Robin I would give it one star.  But I've had better luck with lunches here before, and the rest of my party seemed happy this visit, so three stars it is.   Recently we had an evening reception and needed someplace to go to get a reasonably quick bite to eat before, but not "fast food".  We had one picky eater and a child (not the picky eater!) in our group so we finally settled on Red Robin.  It was early and the hostess seated us right away.  Our server was fantastic.  She was helpful, noted what time we needed to be out by, and made sure we were able to keep to our schedule.  As an appetizer we ordered Buffalo Wings.  They were really good--hot, juicy, yum!  Three of us had a BBQ grilled chicken salad, one had a basic hamburger, and the child had chicken tenders.   It might be my personal preferences, but my salad seemed to be a soggy mess of lettuce, beans, corn, whatever, with a piece of hard, cold chicken coated with an overly-sweet bbq sauce on top.  The other two BBQ grilled chicken salad eaters seemed ok with their salads; one of them is pretty fussy and the other will pretty much be happy with any food.  So maybe it was me.  Anyway, wings and server got 5 stars, my salad got 1 star, previous visits got 3 stars.   Everyone else in my party seemed happy--priceless.

The burgers are solid, the beer is cold (happy hour runs light) and the fries are endless. Fun with a group and you'll never leave hungry. This particular location will almost never give you a burger cooked rarer than medium well. Not sure if this is a policy or if the cooks just can't get it right. If you go in during September/October skip the Oktoberfest Burger. I found it underwhelming, stick with the classics on the menu. The pretzel bun was dry and the German mustard was barely evident and tasteless. Glad I tried it and it's an interesting concept for a burger but they didn't quite pull it off.

meh. i could spend the same amount of money in dc for better burgers. yes it's filling, but only because the buns are the size of my head. i like that the lettuce is shredded, but i'd like more than one slice of tomato. service is really hit or miss. three out of four times i've been here, i've had servers that are incompetent for one reason or another. none have been mean or anything, they're just not good at serving. three out of four times, my food was messed up or not as i ordered. so really, i've never had a great experience. and half the times i've been in there it was empty. i'm really not surprised. mediocre across the board.

I've been to Red Robin several times before, including this location one other time. It was always good until today. I decided to take advantage of their Veterans Day special. I don't know if the staff needs to be trained or the company in general needs to take a note from other chains' playbooks. I was treated like I was using a coupon--not that people using coupons should ever be treated poorly, but it wasn't like I was being thanked for my service. I realize that may sound kind of self-entitled, especially for a guy like me who just did eight years like any other job, but... Well, the words "thanks for your service" or some reasonable facsimile should be said. That's kind of the point, right? It's not like vets really do it for the $6.99 off an order. Beyond the general lack of feeling behind it, the deal was a little lackluster as well. You're limited to just the tavern double cheeseburger (which, being kind of thin, I guess only comes at one temp? I wasn't asked how I liked it, so I assume that's the case). That's fine, except you can't even pay extra to choose one of the different styles. Actually, I take that back. Red Robin's website says you can. The server just told me that they couldn't. That kind of makes it worse. First, the appetizer we ordered, pretzel bites, had the texture of frozen, store-bought pretzels. Not bad, but kind of chewy and not all that great.  When our food finally arrived, it was cold. Not room temperature cold, but like it'd been sitting in the pass for five minutes or so. I pointed this out to the server, who told the manager. To be fair, the manager offered to remake the burgers. But it wasn't that it was inedible, just that it wasn't good (kind of bland, kind of mushy, fully congealed cheese, that kind of thing). And I don't like sending food back unless I absolutely have to. The manager apologized. He said, "We'll make it up to you. I'll start by bringing you some fresh fries." Keep in mind, the tavern double comes with bottomless fries. But since the fries we'd got were colder than the burgers and almost inedible, I wasn't going to argue. When the fries came out, they were piping hot. That was good, but considering how long they remained hot, it really made me wonder how long my food was sitting on the pass. It was also the last we saw of the manager or heard anything about making up for the cold food. Normally, I'd chalk it up to getting what you paid for. I also acknowledge that when we insisted on a different table (the first one we sat at was like being in a wind tunnel), we probably threw things off a little. However, with the app, drinks, and other orders, I really didn't feel like it was worth going there.

First coming to try this place out near my home and the good was decent but the service and the waiter was horrible he never gave us refills to forever I had to ask the people next to for ketchup because he took soooo long. And my husband ask for more fries he took his plate and when he brought it back he don't bring the same plate and my husband ask him what happened to his burger he deny ever taking his plate?  Very rude to take Someone plate without asking them if they are finish. Not a good experience.

I love a good burger, and Red Robin is my favorite in this area.  Burgers are delicious and the bottomless fries are easily the 2nd best reason to visit... and make sure you go nuts with the seasoning!!! Happy hour is pretty legit prices, its something like 2 dollar domestic drafts and 2 dollar well drinks?  Count me in.  Also--- SEXY SERVERS!  Its basically a Hooters lol.  All in all, I rate this location a 5/5 -Park City

Came in on Sunday craving a burger and wanting to watch some Nascar. Food was great, Service was great, our server was working the bar and attending periodically to our table and others.  Very efficient and friendly server!  I tried the Burnin Love Burger and it was great.

Went to this Red Robin on a Monday and it was awful.  The booth we were seated in came with used/soiled napkins on the seats, an unfinished alcoholic beverage tucked on the side near the condiments.  We had to suggest that the drink be moved...and when we did, the server exclaimed..."oh, I thought it was yours."  Interesting, as the server, they should know whether they served the drink...and at the very least, understand that my 9-year old is not a boozer. We also had to practically beg for silverware/napkins.  No one seemed to notice until after our food was served. The general service was slower than my liking (maybe because I just needed the experience to end).   All in all, I was surprised by the cleanliness of this restaurant.  I realize that Monday nights may feature the novice serving staff. I cannot comment on the food.  It was fine but I could not enjoy it due to the atmosphere. My kids have affectionately (and appropriately) named this location "Dead Robin."  Funny kids.

Disappointed. Used to go here previously and enjoyed the burgers and endless fries.   But they have changed. No longer do you get the large basket of fries. Instead, you literally get 7 or 8 fries on the burger plate. We asked for a basket of fries to share with the table since we were really looking forward to bottomless fries.  We received a basket, but again, they barely fill it and so we had to request yet another basket. I'm talking about 4 people in a table and they kept giving small amounts.  The burgers were nothing special. The shredded lettuce in the burger gave us the McDonalds feel.  I would not come back here again.

The best burger chain around. The environment is certainly noisy, but the food is great. The Hawaiian burger with soy sauce and pineapple is the highlight of the menu. They offer "bottomless" fries upon request, and these are served in small portions at a time. (When having a half-pound burger, you won't have much space for fries anyway.) The wait staff are attentive and friendly. Waiting for a table can be the only problem, with waits between 20-45 minutes not uncommon.

Oh the places you will go!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! just not this place........... Dear GOD! Why me!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I went here ..expecting better after the manager reached out to me...and apologized for my bad server...  This time my server was mad cool... on point on most stuff... but for the life of me... the food was horrid!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I mean... my burger was suppose to be med well... Instead, I got a crusty char burned burger... yuck..................... My Arnold Palmer tasted like diluted Lipton black tea with a splash of lemon... my wings................. Im an Angry Bird on this............ was   a crisp... and now they serve some lame ass chips with it? No celery or carrots........!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  My vanilla shake was naked... no whip cream or sprinkles!! wth!!!!!!!!!! They are sooo stingy with fries wth!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 5 fries and it aint crispy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! thats ittttttttttt!!!!!!!!!! I am done with Red Robin... Omggggggggggggggggggg one day the service sucksss and the next time the food sucks.....................:(

I love the food, but the service really is terrible. I think it's all 16 year old kids working there or something. The food can sometimes take over 45 minutes to arrive and good luck getting a drink refilled without having to practically tackle someone to get their attention. Be sure to ask for more "bottomless" fries from the jump because if you wait, you'll never get a refill.

Red Robin is a hot spot for my office to go to lunch and rightfully so. This is my favorite burger chain in general and this location has always given me good service.  All the burgers I have tried here have been good even if they were slightly over cooked for medium rare. The fries are great and if you have them with your meal definitely ask for a side of the Onion Ring Sauce. That sauce is the main reason I consistently crave Red Robin. Come here for lunch.....or dinner they have a full bar and lots of TVs positioned around the restaurant.

This place just gets worse and worse. Waitress was nice enough. Quick took our order and brought back drinks; after that it was downhill. Three times we heard "Your food is on it's way, I promise. Can I get you another refill?" I look around and no one in the restaurant has food. How hard is it to make a burger? How much time does it take? Apparently VERY and an hour or so. When I asked for a basket of fries to help pass time we were given literally 10 fries on a plate. What happened to the huge basket?!? Eventually we got our meal and of course when it's time to pay the manager comes by to ask how everything was. She seemed genuinely surprised when I said it was painfully slow. None the less, this place is off my list. Off to find a better burger...

Ok, I'm gonna make this short and sweet. Burger is not great. The beef patty is thin and lacks flavor. Reminds me of the frozen hockey pucks you buy at Costco and put it the pan. This burger was really all Bun....Steak fries are steak fries are steak fries. Anyone of us can go to giant, buy a bag and fry them up! Next time I want a good burger I'm going down the street to 5 guys.

First time dining at Red Robin, had an okay experience. The raspberry lemonade were refreshing and thirst quenching after spending all day site seeing. The guacamole and chips appetizer were OK. I had the Guacamole burger with sweet potato fries, even though the first batch of fries were not very hot, I devoured them. The second batch of sweet potato fries were warm and tasted even better. The serves was acceptable. And the manager was nice enough to stop by and evaluate our experience at the restaurant. I would recommend this place for very casual dining with groups. There were very fast at getting my group a table.

My experience this time around was ok. Wed night, didnt feel like cooking, took hubs and baby to red robin. Our server must have been extra busy with other things, because she didnt really come to see us too often. I frequent this place all the time, so I wont hold it against them. Bonsai burger is my all time fav!
good all-around family restaurant consistently good food and service ... tall beer and excellent burgers... medium rare! my son loves the riblets

burgers are good here a few of my friends got the royal robin burger with egg and they all seemed to like it i got the bacon guac burger cus it's one of my friends fav.. it was delicious.. the creamy guac and crispy bacon! i love that they give you bottomless fries. so if you order a meal with the bottomless fries which i think most sandwich burgers come with you can always ask for fries to come out before the burger... you can also ask for bottomless garlic fries or sweet potato fries (the sweet potato takes a lil longer) if you go with a few friends you can order all three :P service was not good this time around.. our server was really busy. i asked for water and lemon about 3 times.. and when the basket of fries came out some of the baskets had hot fries but mine had a mix of warm and hot fries.. i like my fries and food hot! so it was a little disappointing... but i am a fan of red robin ;)

I have given this place way too many chances since it's the only burger place around. They can't seem to get my order right for a cooked to order burger how hard is it to have a well done burger!?  Plus the bartenders are not very friendly when you are picking up....

Service is always slow. Wouldn't go except my daughter likes the place. Slow service and a slower kitchen. Last time I went, they lost my order. The manager was kind enough to take care of the meal but this is not the first time I have waited long. The food was fine but each time I go, I am waiting for food for a long time.

After getting a 1 hour wait time estimate from a restaurant across the street, our defeated group of 8 walked into Red Robin and was seated immediately. Nestled in a cozy corner booth, we ordered beverages from the friendly server and started our crazy and wild Saturday night (because Red Robin is where all epic Saturday nights start... right?). Service was friendly and burgers came out pretty quickly. I had the Grilled Turkey Burger, which came with a toasted whole grain bun and chipotle aioli. It light enough that I didn't feel like a massive whale after eating this like I usually do after eating burgers, but substantial enough to make me feel full. I went with the fruit salad (which is not one of their unlimited side options), which came out in a mini ramekin full of mushy strawberries, apples, and canned oranges. I'd recommend going with their bottomless fries, salad, or broccoli because those options were freshly made.

Service was beyond slow. They brought the wrong food and then waited almost 20 minutes for them to bring the right thing. I noticed other people around us experiencing the same problem. I rarely write reviews and even less rare bad ones, but this one is much deserved. I would avoid this place like the plague.

I used to work here and I can say it's still as bad now as it was then. Mom found a hair in her salad, it was cooked inside the chicken. We were a party of 8 and all of our food was cold, bland, and fries were stale. They are stingy with their fries idk why since they are free refills so you constantly have to ask for more and they seem bothered when you do and take forever to come out. I'm done with this location for now on I'll go to the lake forest location

My dad has always said three things: 1) Always use protection when banging loose women. 2) Ohio State can beat anybody at football on any given day: the Denver Broncos, the Miami Sharks, the Cleveland Browns - okay, on second thought, maybe Ohio State has a chance against the Brownies as long as Brandon Weeden is on the roster 3) Red Robin might be the worst restaurant chain in existence. Okay, two out of three isn't bad. I was seated right away. Yes, that was the highlight of my visit. The server took a good 20 minutes before he blindsided me and surprised me by asking me what I wanted to drink, only to vanish for another 20 minutes. Were they really that understaffed at 7 pm?!? After 40 minutes of waiting, he finally comes back and takes my order. He then vanished into thin air...you see where this is going. An hour had passed. Still no food. What gave? Apparently they have a slaughterhouse and a farm back in the kitchen so they can cook their burgers as freshly as humanly possible. Not. After 70 minutes of waiting, my Guacamole Burger came out with 5-10 steak fries (hey, the steak fries are "bottomless"). The burger itself was not "gourmet". It was very bland. I could barely taste the guac. I'm not saying 'Where's the beef'; I'm saying ' Where's the guac'. At least the fry seasoning wasn't that bad, although my taste buds are telling me that the fry seasoning is a carbon copy of Steak n' Shake's seasoning. My dad has eaten at Red Robins in Ohio and Pennsylvania. He said he had a horrible experience at every Red Robin restaurant he's been to. Now, I can understand why he felt that way, even though my burger was in Greater Washington, DC, the "gourmet burger capital of America". The only way Red Robin makes it up to me is if they get some loose women and send them over to my apartment. I'm never going back. Unless hookers and blackjack are involved.

Man, what happened to this chain?  I mean, I doubt anyone ever went to Red Robin expecting fine dining but the chain has always had huge burgers and good food.    We decided to stop at Red Robin while out shopping during the holiday season at around noon on a Saturday because it was literally the only place we could find that didn't have a huge line.  We were seated promptly and greeted quickly by our server.  I ordered a beer and my girlfriend ordered a strawberry lemonade.  My beer was delivered about 10 minutes later but no sign of the lemonade.  After asking about it, it showed up about 10 minutes after that with an apology from the server. We ordered our food.  I decided on the Peppercorn burger and some onion rings.  30 minutes later, our food had not arrived.  I had another beer (because of course I did) and we waited.  We weren't in a hurry but we were both hungry.  Eventually, the food showed up and man, what a let-down.  I ordered my burger medium rare and it came out well done without a trace of pink.  It was pretty clear why these burgers were easy to overcook.  It seems that since I visited Red Robin last, the chain made a decision to cut costs by switching from their big gourmet burgers to paper thin, flavorless burgers one would expect to see at a drive-thru fast food joint.  I showed the server and she did offer to recook it but I figured it really wouldn't matter much since the burger really wasn't thick enough to cook properly anyway.   The onion rings were good but to be frank, it's pretty hard to screw up onion rings. We finished our meal and left.  The server discounted our check without us even having to ask which was nice.  The two stars above are for the server making the best out of a bad situation.   Red Robin is not overly pricey, but it's too expensive for what basically amounts to fast food.  We won't be back.

My wife and I are fans of Red Robin because they have fun meal selections like beer shakes and fish and chips, however, over the past six months it has been tedious going there. Our wait times for entrees had been an average of 25min or above. Staff was friendly enough but all the waiting around for food, refills, and check was very frustrating. We will probably ask our relatives to stop gifting us Red Robin gift cards.

Went to Red Robin in Germantown last night. Everything about it was terrible. Will never go back. Ordered the riblets and Mac and cheese. Riblets were horrible should of been to referred to as poop on a stick. Mac and cheese was cold and had no flavor. The seafood scatter which was nothing but soggy flavorless rubber fish. Also had the Pear- tini which was nothing but juice. Last but not least one of the favorite things we get at RR is the onion rings, which were fried too long to the point where it cut the roof of your mouth. I guess my final rewiew is will never go back there again, place has really changed in the past 4-6 months. Sorry for you Red Robin, will never go back or never recommend it to anyone. Thanks for the runs all day Saturday.

I've been to this location many times over the years and just recently in the last couple months the service and food quality has drastically fallen off.  I went on a Monday evening and it was not busy at all, which is why I was confused that we had to wait 10 or so minutes for someone to even acknowledge we had walked in the door.  We finally just sat ourselves in the bar section and I just took some menus off of the hostess stand.  Our waiter informed us that he was new which is fine, but when you only have 2 or 3 other tables to serve, I felt like our wait to be served should have been much shorter.  He would come by every 320 minutes or so.  We ordered some fries and dipping sauce which got to our table before our drinks did, and I just sat and watched our drinks sit there at the bar for 15 minutes before the bartender finally came over with them.  After waiting 30 minutes for our burgers the waiter came by and looked surprised that we hadn't gotten them yet and said he'd see what the problem was, but I kind of think he might have forgotten to even put our orders in.  The burgers were ok, not worth all the waiting around we had to do in the process though.  The manager did come by and apologize for the inconvenience and gave us our burgers for free, but from the looks of the other tables this has become common practice for numerous mistakes that are being made.  Just not a good experience at all and I don't think I'll be coming back here anytime soon.

I've eaten here several times, and it isn't bad. I love the freckled lemonade. Guac burger is good. Good O rings. But it's just Burger King on steroids...I just can't justify giving a burger place more than 3 stars.

After walking in we were told there was a 20 mins wait. When our table was ready, we saw that there was plenty of tables and also some waiting to be cleaned.  It just showed that the floor manager really didn't manage the floor well. After sitting down for 5 minutes, our waiter finally came to take drink order (note that the floor wasn't that busy.)  We put in our whole order because we were ready.  The food was average but the table was so sticky it just grossed me out.  And when the waitress brought our food over, she noticed we had no silverware.  She said she was going to bring some.  Our waiter then stopped by and said he was brining over some napkins (he didn't notice we had no silverware). 5 mins later, no signs of either. I went to get our silverware myself.  Neither of them ever came back until we were almost done with the napkins.   On our way out, we tried to play one of the arcade machines. It took out money but didn't work. We reported to the hostess who said we were the second one with the problem (you would think they would post a sign after the first incident...)   She said she was going to go find somebody.  Almost 10 minutes later she finally came back with money and said to us 'play at your own risk'...excuse me??  Then you should have post a sign!!  What's with the attitude??

Honestly I been here many times never have had a bad experience.  All the waiters we've had gratefully been good service  The food is good and the unlimited fries yummy!  The atmosphere feels Pretty cool it's a nice kick back spot would be better if they were opened laaaaater lol  Need I say the 5/8  We went in like 20 mins before closing and the waitress was nice and attentive and didn't rush us or rush herself like some areas that want to rush their customers into ordering. She did a good job to bad I don't know her name :/
Will have to update this review after another visit. The bottomless fries are great, I don't even order appetizers.

Very disappointing experience. Waitstaff pleasant enough but drinks and most certainly the food took WAY too long. Explanation was "burger maker was broken". Manager was supposed to speak with us but never come to apologize for the restaurant's shortcomings. No comps either.  Would prefer to give half-star. Food average and not worth the wait. Won't be back.

This is a great place to go and eat the burgers are nice sized (and delicious of course)and who doesn't want endless basket of fries??? Also drinks even the specialty (non alcoholic) ones like strawberry lemonade and so forth....The service is GREAT also!!!! 5 stars all the way!

Normaly good food and service, & by the most part it was this trip also. My only complaint this time is since my last visit they changed their salt and pepper shaker to grinders and they have no adjustments on them and the salt comes out too big, i don't like putting ROCK SALT on my food. If they fix that my visits will be more pleasant.

I have been coming here since high school whenever I crave a gourmet burger. The burger meat itself kind of tastes like frozen beef thrown on the BBQ at home, which isnt bad... but really isnt good either. But they make up for it with the bottomless stuff. Bottomless Garlic Fries and Freckled Lemonade. MWAHAHAHAHAHA Soooo good. My favorite has to be the Peppercorn burger with a fried egg added to it. Adding a ooey-gooey fried egg to any burger just makes it all the better. :D
The burger was so undercooked I had to send it back!  It took so long to re-cook it, by the time it was finished, my party was finished eating.  Not a great experience at all!

This was my first time at the Germantown location. After telling my buddies about the bottomless fries, I knew this was going to be our Saturday lunch. :) We were greeted right away and taken to a table for four. Vanessa came took our drink order while we were waiting for 2 more to join us. As I was hungry and love to eat, I ordered a tower of onion rings and pretzel bites. Neither disappointed. The onions were fried perfectly and came with a dish of ranch and a creamy bbq sauce. Who would have thought it, but yummo! The pretzel bites looked like they were fried but were not greasy. They came with a little cup of melted cheese with a little kick to it. Towards the bottom I noticed some minced onions. Yum! We ordered the chicken ciabatta sandwich, the tavern double, a bacon burger and plain burger with A-1. The burgers were great! I asked for my fries well-done. They came out regular. I had to flag down Vanessa to get another order of fries. She made a comment that she was moving as fast as she could while pregnant. We told Vanessa that we were going to order a milkshake but needed a second to determine which flavor. She came back 10 minutes later. Really??? We almost left but the 11 year old at the table was very insistent that we have a mint brownie monster milkshake. For $5 the wait was almost tolerable. There were a ton of brownie chunks in that milkshake....so good!!! We were there for 2 hours. At 3pm on a Saturday afternoon, there was no reason for us to be there that long. As the daughter of a single Mom who worked 3 jobs and waited tables, I have the utmost sympathy for working Moms...but when you can't find your server and you have to flag down a busboy, a hostess and even a manager....I think sympathy has crossed the line. My review should have been a 5 because the food was that good! Sorry Vanessa. Ask your co-workers for help because you were slow, slow. too slow.

Just like so many of the other reviews here I had a good meal at this Red Robin (I've eaten there in CA, AZ, and KS recently and now MD) but the service was slow and indifferent and the prices higher than normal.  I was staying nearby for work and dropped in for a patty melt and some bottomless fries.  After seating myself at the bar to watch the baseball game, I ordered fast (already knew what I wanted) with just some water to drink.  Thankfully I didn't have to wait on a beer or mixed drink, god knows how long that would've taken.  So I'm watching the baseball playoffs and out of the corner of my eye I can see the kitchen.  I see a patty melt sitting under the heat lamps.  Servers would approach it, read the ticket, and then move away.  My server was nowhere in sight.  Finally, maybe 35 minutes after I ordered, some other server brings the patty melt that had been sitting under the heat lamps over to the bar area and it finally gets to me.  Hey now!  Thankfully the patty melt and fries were tasty.  I finish the fries and expect my server to ask me if I would like another order of the fries (or maybe some of the ranch dressing for them).  So I wait.  And I wait. And I wait. And I wait.  Finally she asks if there's anything else I want.  I just shook my head, nope.  Sorry kid, you're supposed to ask if I want more fries.  What if this was my first visit to a Red Robin?  How do I know about the bottomless fries?   Really poor finish for a decent meal, though I left a 20% tip, I really should've cut it to 10%.  I'm not sure why this restaurant among all the Red Robins I've visited is so slow and fails to ask if you want more fries but FIX IT.

I love Red Robin. This location I've never had an issue with until recently. They seem understaffed or the staff needs more training. I ordered a take-out order over the phone. They told me 15 minutes. I came in 20 minutes, and still had to wait at the bar for another 10-15 minutes. The girl apologized for the wait, but I could clearly see she needed help, as she was doing the job of several. My food was sitting there the whole time and I was waiting for her to make the milkshake. I ordered fish and clam chowder, which obviously get cold really fast. I was too hungry to complain or wait even longer for a manager... but I think the best thing would have been offering to make me a fresh order... or something!

The last couple of times we've gone here, the service has been really slow.  We waited for about 30 minutes for food, and it was nothing complicated.  I feel like you should get a basket of fries on the table, just something so we aren't sitting there waiting and waiting.   One of the kids dropped their corn dog, so we had to order another one and that took another ten minutes, I'm sure they just microwave it so why so long AND they charged us for another meal, I just don't get it.  Just saying, "sorry for the wait" isn't enough - you have to prove that you value our business. Also, my child spent the night throwing up his spaghetti, not sure what happened there either.
Worst service ever.  We waited 45 min for our food and then left.  We were never given refills or given an update on our food.  Won't be  back!

Red Robin never lets me down! Love this place! I do like this location better than the LakeForest restaurant. Our waitress was so sweet and catering to us, I will be returning. As always, I highly recommend the Freckled Lemonade! Can't go to Red Robin without getting one. (And for the adults, I recommend the Mai Tai.)

I'd like to simply write "THE WORST RESTAURANT EVER!!!" and call it a day. Not sure if Yelp would approve. So let me describe my last dining experience here, keeping in mind that it was representative of nearly every meal I've had at this restaurant. My special lady friend and I came in on a Tuesday night. There was no wait since most of the tables and booths were empty. We stood at the hostess podium for nearly 5 minutes before someone finally walked over and asked "how many?" There was no other greeting. No smile. No eye contact at all. We were briskly escorted to our booth which had not been cleaned. The dirty dishes were gone, but there was water and crumbs and stickiness everywhere. There was also food all over my seat. The hostess said nothing while she waited for us to sit down to this mess. I politely asked for another booth and she sighed loudly as she seated us elsewhere. We finally sat down and waited. And waited. At least 20 minutes passed before our server appeared. No introduction, no apology for the wait, only "do you know what you want?" "Some silverware please," I responded. We ordered drinks, an appetizer, and our entrees. I also ordered a Monster Chocolate Shake. My soda arrived with ketchup and greasy fingerprints encrusted around the outside of the glass. After one sip of her soda, my friend complained that it tasted flat and "dirty." The chocolate shake I ordered wasn't chocolate. I couldn't tell what flavor it was. It had no flavor. We waited for our server to return so replacements could be ordered. 35 more minutes passed and no sign of her. I dropped $10 on the table and got up to leave. We were putting on our coats when a food runner arrived with our entrees. Still no silverware or napkins, drinkable beverages, or the appetizer we ordered. He told us he'd check on it, but never returned. Eventually our waitress wandered over. We requested new drinks, cancelled the missing tower of onion rings, and again asked for napkins and silverware. More than an hour had passed since we were seated when someone finally brought me a drink in a clean glass. And it was flat. And it tasted "dirty." I've worked in restaurants for years. More years than I'd like to admit. I know that unless the fountainheads (the plastic spouts) on the soda dispenser are cleaned and disinfected on a regular basis, mold and bacteria can grow. The syrup from the soda is a perfect food source for germs to flourish. Once enough crap gets growing on the fountainheads, the soda starts tasting dirty as those germs get washed into people's drinks. Nothing like a dash of mold to flavor your Diet Coke.  My replacement shake was melted, looking more like chocolate milk. It's not a complicated recipe. Just two simple ingredients: milk and ice cream. Not that fucking hard to make. I pushed my drinks aside and stared down at my sad, sad, chicken sandwich and the 7 french fries they generously gave me. 7 cold french fries. I wondered if they had been left behind on someone else's plate and then recycled. My friend ordered her cheeseburger "extra well done, almost burnt." Instead the inside was pink. Very pink. We sat quietly while we waited for our waitress to return. 25 more minutes passed and still no waitress. The odds of getting new fries and a well done burger before breakfast were almost zero. The odds of us coming back were less than zero. I grabbed a manager as he walked by and I asked for the check. For just the second time in my life I left no tip. Had Red Robin done the right thing, they would have comped the entire meal, reimbursed me for the wasted gas money, and bought me dinner at a real restaurant. Instead I paid nearly $40 for the worst dining experience I can remember.

I can understand some of the bad reviews however I think this location is just understaffed. Our waiter, Josh, was attentive and polite. I was impressed with the flavor. This burger could compete with my favorite one at burger joint. Fries were crisp, hot, fresh. Burger was juicy, flavorful, cooked perfectly. Service was slow but attentive and polite. Price is reasonable; my burger was $6.99 (not including soda) I would recommend going during busy hours to ensure fresh food and a smile.

Disclaimer:  This review was written by my wife who spent 10+ years in the food industry as a server, bartender, and manager... she knows what she's talking about. I want to start by saying that I have been going to this location since it first opened.  I used to frequent it often and really enjoyed it.  I never hesitated to recommend it to friends/family.  After our visit today, I can honestly say that I won't be back.  Here is a rundown of our experience this evening... We were a party of two and were sat immediately although it was inside while we requested outside.  There were about eight open tables on the patio, we were told at first that it wouldn't be a problem but, after our seater spoke to the main hostess it became abundantly clear that it would be a hassle for them. "A party of eight was going out there and they just weren't sure how many tables they would need"... again there were seven or eight unused tables, indicated by the umbrellas being down (something the seater initially explained)... No big deal, but would have preferred to see them go the extra mile to try and accommodate a simple request, no one even checked. The restaurant itself is starting to look a bit rundown, the place was dirty, the floor had trash, spills, etc., and our table was sticky.  The bathrooms were dirty and poorly stocked, the women's room had no toilet seat covers but it did have an employee hanging out in it on her cell phone...   Worst of all our silverware came out with something on it, grossly akin to used dental floss.  The second set we received, which the server assured me she "scrubbed" herself, was also dirty (pictures are attached). Our server was oblivious, and seemed very bored or distracted.  I didn't feel welcomed, I don't remember her smiling once.  She was not the only one on  the staff that was struggling.  We watched as a table near us, with a hungry toddler, sat for 20 minutes unacknowledged by anyone until the mother sought out a server herself, they then sat another 7 minutes waiting for him to help them (at this point the rush was dying down, no excuse) ... when their server finally showed up her timing was comical to me and her shuffling gait was not indicative of someone who had been MIA for 20 minutes.  Not long after that a gentleman at the table next to ours spent several minutes trying to get the attention of any one of a gaggle of servers at a terminal, all just standing around chatting, it honestly seemed as though they were intentionally ignoring him, I even tried to flag someone down for him, he finally had to get up and go to them to request extra  napkins.  Everything from our drinks to our check and take out order for my husband (which the server almost forgot altogether) was SLOW.  This can be attributed to the Friday night rush to some degree but from what I could see of the line, I suspect it had alot more to do with expo, runners, and servers.   That is our segway to the food, it was just okay.  Honestly I don't expect anything phenomenal from a burger joint especially a not-so fast food place but I have never been so disappointed with Red Robin.  One of the great things about this restaurant is that it is usually pretty good and reliable.  Today it was underwhelming and SLOW, admittedly the experience may have made me more critical of the food but that just emphasizes the importance of the front of the house staff!  My son and I had fried jalapenos to start, they were way too salty and totally over cooked.  That was followed a twenty minute wait for food.  At no point there did the server come by to offer refills or see how we were doing.  When she finally showed up she came from the bathroom and was shocked that we hadn't received our meals yet (something she might have noticed had she stopped by sooner).  After she dropped off our food she disappeared again, never checking back to see if our food was okay or if we needed anything else... I digress from the food... My son ordered the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Wrap, this is something my husband has ordered in the past so I thought it would be great for the boy, it was so weak.  It was 80% shredded lettuce, my 9 yr old questioned the freshness of the chicken, saying even he could tell it had been frozen, not sure how he could tell there was so little chicken to it and even less flavor.  I was excited to try the new Nacho Crunch Tavern Double which boasts a mouth-watering blend of flavors in it's description... I have to call foul on the claim, I paid twice what I would have for a burger at Five Guys, and got a  burger that was just okay (nowhere near what the menu described).  The fries were under cooked and kind of saggy but at this point, that is just a footnote ...  I am sorry to say that I won't be back, it has always been a favorite "guilty" indulgence and fun celebration place for report cards and sports endeavors and such.  I would prefer to keep the memory of Red Robin as it was.

Going Downhill.  I'm not sure if it's management, kitchen staff, or waitstaff, but my impression of the place is plummeting quickly with every visit.   Smelly booth tables from dirty rags used to wipe them down?   Soaking wet tables that were not properly wiped down? This place needs a new manager and a new owner! This particular Red Robin use to be my fav. I ordered a ultimate Marguerita to start, sent it back, it was a sour mess! I ordered water. The fries are horrible and need to be fresh. We never got utensils. Clearly they are low on staff and need direction. Disappointed!

I have been to this location twice now and in general my experience has been pretty consistent. They usually seem pretty slammed or overwhelmed when I'm there. During my last visit it took quite some time for our food to arrive. It must have taken at least 20 minutes for our two sandwiches to arrive. However, the server, although seemingly flustered, managed to stay positive and attentive. She gave an effort to be pleasant and courteous and I appreciate that.  Now for the food. I ordered the royal red Robin with the fried egg. I've had it in the past where the egg is overcooked. This egg was perfectly runny. The burger was cooked to my liking and the fries were nice and hot. My second order of bottomless fries arrived much faster. I also ordered the bottomless root beer float. I was a little disappointed in the fact that the ice cream and root beer were not separate. In the past I was given a glass of root beer and a glass of ice cream to combine myself, and add more soda as I go. I didn't have that this time around, not did I receive a spoon for the ice cream. That being said, I have not real complaints about the food. Just needs a bit more attention or streamlining with the service and it would be much improved.

So we went to Red Robin the other night to use a gift card we had received for Christmas.  We hadn't been in a while and liked the new decor change.  Red chairs were more stylish and more comfortable then the ones from before. No onto the service.  Waiter was very good and attentive.  Personable and courteous and kept checking to see if we needed anything. Timing impeccable between appetizer and meal. A for service  Food was good.  We had the BBQ wings as an appetizer.  They were very good.  Fresh and hot.  I had the bleu ribbon burger, daughters had regular cheeseburgers from the kids menu.  Wife had the salad which was HUGE.  So huge that it spilled off the plate.  She asked for a larger plate to transfer it to, but nothing exists.  May want to revise how to serve that salad although the wife said it tasted good, even if some ended up on the table. Food gets an A- Overall experience far better than we've had in the past and will actually end up in us coming back without a gift card. Well done Red Robin.

First visit.  Came here for post Star Wars dinner with a party of 6.  Service was great.  Food was great.  Split a burger with my husband cause I had too much popcorn.  Extra plate without asking.  Had the endless root beer float too and got my second refill without asking and before I got to the bottom of the first!  Chain offers military discount which is always appreciated.

No! No! No! I was at home with my family and I wanted to get out after this snow blizzard. Last time I was here was about a year ago. I was craving a burger and some dessert but I would've had a better meal at any other burger joint. The service was horrendous. I asked our server to clean up our table ( tiny table, three of us plus a baby) because we were ready for some dessert. She left all of the plates. I had to move the plates to the other table because we needed room.  Im not sure if they don't clean up until you leave anymore because there were at LEAST seven dirty tables. THEY WERENT EVEN BUSY and i saw about 3 others doing noting.  The new payment method is to pay credit card only so we asked for the check because we had some cash. We were very specific when we said we were going to pay half and half, waived chick down a couple of times and got ignored. We ended up paying with a card so we wouldnt wait any longer and the machiene never printed a receipt.  Oh.. i could've had a yummier burger at burger king.  We had the oreo mud cake for dessert and it tasted like it had been in the fridge uncovered for years. Old.  Our cups that our sodas were in looked dirty. I promise i could see fingerprints from the last person who drank from it.  Anyway, A WORD TO WHOEVER IS RUNNING THIS PLACE!!needs to do a reevaluation of their staff, chefs, and busers! THIS IS A GREAT FAMILY SPOT usually, what happened?? The only nice person, or part of the experience was the hostess.. although she tried to sit us as we were leaving. I had to remind her we had already ate. Wont be back. No thanks.

Went to Red Robin last night, it took an hour to get our entrées and they gave me the wrong burger so I sent it back. We also got our appetizer of onion rings after our burgers and that was after our waiter sent back the first order because it was sitting out so long that they had gotten cold. To top it all off our waiter took another 30 mins after our meal to bring us our check. Worst dining experience I have ever had.

This Red Robin location is pretty middle of the road for me. I've never had a bad experience here, but nothing was particularly above and beyond either. The food is always good, and generally cooked the way I like it. The staff is friendly and fairly quick. Although, they certainly do get swamped in the evenings (and the weekends I imagine). The parking lot is pretty much a jumbled mess that easily gets congested from the nearby IHOP. I typically order my burgers medium from here, and they usually arrive somewhere between medium and medium-well. Whenever I've ordered a fried egg on top, I'm glad to report that it arrives a little runny. I hate getting an overcooked fried egg. It's like, "What was even the point then?!" The fries have always been hot and crispy. No problems getting refills on their bottomless fries, but I've always had to have the initiative to ask for it after getting my burger. If I waited until he or she checked in on me, I wouldn't get it until most of my meal was done. It would be nice if they asked about refills as the food was dropped off. Also, I love a juicy burger, but more often than not, the bottom bun is usually soaked by the time I get to dig into it.  This location always seems to serve their burger a tad bit greasier than at other locations. I've ordered a root beer float from here, and it was okay. I've been to other locations where they fill it 50/50 with soft serve and root beer and bring an extra glass of root beer so you can refill it with root beer as needed. This is also perfect for when you like your root beers to be part beverage/ part dessert, like myself. This location also has a nifty new gadget on the tables that I've only seen before a handful of times. This little computer screen is helpful for places like this that can easily get slammed. There's a button for alerting your server in case you can't seem to spot him or her for a refill or more napkins. You can also play games, explore the menu further, sign-up for a loyalty card, and pay with your credit card. This is pretty ingenious, especially if you're wary about handing over your credit card or hate waiting for your check. I'm hoping this becomes more ubiquitous in the restaurant industry. Although, I do feel that it shouldn't allow for service to decline. This location could definitely use some work on that especially in terms of consistency and being a step ahead on their refill game. Why keep calling fries and drinks bottomless if I have to chase you around for it?

I haven't ever been a frequent customer, but I have been here many times over the years. I have no big praises or complaints for most of my visits. Food was okay and service was okay.  The last time I was here, my toddler was struggling to eat his macaroni and cheese and I realized it was because there was a very long, black, curly hair tangled around his spoon, in his noodles, and in. His. Mouth. I wanted to barf. We stopped eating. Explained and showed the waiter (I wish I'd gotten a picture for this review) and he quickly whisked it away, looking quite horrified himself. He brought new Mac and cheese and removed it from the check, of course. But that was it. The manager didn't come over. No other efforts were made to compensate for such a disgusting, appetite-killing, incident. I felt like they should have gone to greater lengths.  Like I said, you may make it years unscathed, but if you go, take a close look at your food and your children's food before you begin eating.

We have been going to Red Robins since it opened up in Germantown, MD. To-date till this past Saturday, we have had a good experience.  This time we had a horrible experience. From seating to food it was a disaster. The hostess was more interested in talking to her co-workers rather than seating us. The waitress was too busy (though the restaurant was 60% empty) to come and take an order. When we placed our order for drinks and an appetizer, the drinks came, but there were no napkins or stirrer for the drinks. The appetizer never came. Right after our drinks were served, the main course was served, and then it dawned on the server that we had ordered an appetizer, which we refused because of the main course already served. The food was cold and not cooked properly. Finally, at our request, the manager came and despite our complaint and the return of food to be re-cooked and served, it was the same food served without anything done. We then observed it was not only us but several people around us on other tables had the same complaints. We by then were so tired of complaining, we asked for our check, the manager did give us a discount but for the service and the food, we should not have been charged. After paying our bill and walking out of the restaurant we observed the filth on the floor with napkins all around, but the most appalling unhygienic thing were the tablets that are placed on each table for on-line ordering. The screens were so dirty and it appeared that they have not been cleaned since installed. With this experience, we have decided never to go back to Red Robins, at least the one on Century Blvd., Germantown, MD.

I go to Red Robin because my children enjoy it so much.  I'm not sure if it's because of the "Ziosk" that they can play on resembling their tablets or the smiley face pizza.  My kids are picky eaters, I've come to realize that it's not the food that keeps us coming, it's the family atmosphere.  Actually, the food NEVER comes out fresh.  Now by fresh I mean, hot...steam still coming from the fries.  Instead the fries ALWAYS come out flat, hard, and just plain old tasting.  Okay, I'm a picky eater too, but is it too much to ask for hot food? I mean I could've probably done better at IHOP next door or Longhorn...heck, even the Chick fil A across the way!  I have never left this place satisfied with my meal.   I usually get the Bonzai burger with pineapples, it's okay...not terrible and not great either.  I figure since my kids love this place so much I'd better figure out a dish that I am okay with.  The pineapples are overcooked and a little watery.  The flavor is decent.   The servers have always been great though.  I have no complaints about that.  This particular Red Robin is just missing the "IT" factor.  It's just a place to go to get a kick out of your kids enjoying themselves (i.e. Playing on the tablet, coloring Red Robin, writing on the chalk board etc.). The food is not where it's at.

*I have only done takeout from this location, so this review is based solely on the takeout aspect* I have gotten takeout a few times from this location, and have had a serious of increasingly worse service and experiences.  At best, this location is disorganized but will get you close to the order you asked for (may forget sides, clumsy construction, etc.) My last visit here however, was so bad that even after an "apologetic" gift card from the company, it is not worth it to return to this location.  I was told my food would take 45 minutes, was placed on hold to place my order for quite a while, and then was hung up on while on hold.  When I called back I was told that the previous staff member "was just an idiot" and that it would take 15 minutes.  I ordered 2 burgers and when I went to pick it up there was only one.  The staff member continued to rudely arguing with me, insisting that I was wrong and had only ordered 1 burger, and that I must be lying to her. My issue here is, I simply wanted what I ordered and was not asking for a discount, etc. for their mistake.  The staff here make you feel bad for requesting the order you asked for.  Overall it seems takeout here is simply not worth the effort of dealing with the combative and confused staff.

I just came from dining here with my family. Kelsey was our server; WORST SERVER EVER! We ordered a lot of food, including a n appetizer--which never came out. She never once asked about the appetizer nor gave us any news on the appetizer, she brought out our food all together after she told me herself she'd bring our appetizer our first. I let it go because our food came out. She didn't come to check on us until 28 mins after our food was down; yes I timed her. We all needed refills and a few of my guests wanted a refill on fries. Why did we ask for anything at all; it took 12 mins for the fries to come out and half of our refills to come. We reminded her what refills she forgot and she left and never came back until it was time for the check. She mentioned to us that we could pay with credit card on the Ziosk machine, which was a fail, because after flagging her down to ask her about the check, she said, "oh, I never linked your table number to the machine." I told her about taking off the appetizer because we never got it and mentioned to her that she no longer had to bring us the drinks since it's now been over 20 mins since we asked for them and got only two, out of 8. All she did was shrug, say, "oh okay," smiled and walked away. Red Robin is now on my DON'T GO list. I would HATE to pull the race card on this one but the way she treated us was along the lines. It's been over a year since I've dined here because the last time I came, I was sat and never attended. I sat for over 10 mins with not a soul to greet my table. Unacceptable.
Not a very good traveling experience. Burger undercooked long wait after being seated.

We were eating and my husband noticed the ledge had Ants crawling about!  We let the waiter know. And he informed us that he had already let the mgmnt. know but he would say something again. This is a bit disturbing. No manager came to speak with us either. We finished our meal. As we left my husband mentioned it to the hostess. She proceeded to let us know they already knew and would not be seating anyone at the booth. What is disturbing is that the Ants crawl or walk along the entire window sill. So it affects more than one booth. It is n issue in this restaurant. We left feeling itchy for the rest of our 3 hour drive.   Between the service being slow as you will see from other comments and the Ant issue. Most likely from the restaurant not being very clean. Which it is NOT. This is Gross!!!    I don't give reviews very often but this needed to be reported.  We love Red Robin. This one was horrid!

They have a recurring problem that needs to be rectified; the Ensenada Chicken is constantly under-cooked.  It comes out with pink sections; this is NOT a one-time event.  I order this dish constantly and tonight was the last straw, over the past three months I have been served under-cooked Ensenada Chicken 50% of the time.  The bar tender said, "Unfortunately it happens way too often."  There is no excuse for repeated under-cooked meals.

Food is decent here but the service is horrible. Keep trying to give it another chance but service never improves. Seems like every time I have gone I've had to wait 15+ minutes to just be greeted by the server and have to ask for things multiple times (dressing, refills, etc.).  At times I'll be in the mood for their grilled chicken sandwich but in my opinion it's not worth the subpar service.
If you expect to get seated, forget it. Ther is never a hostess when you need one. Been going to red robin past two weeks and no one is at the front door to greet you and take you to your seats.
Dick and cheese worst time ever the device was really bad dick and cheese I'm so pissed

I tried many times with different burgers and chicken sandwiches and I always get the runs, the place looks nicely renovated but there's got to be some kind of cross contamination  while is been cook or just poor hygiene,and looks like there's a competition between servers to see who has more piercings on,.. and that's all I got to say about my experience the last time I was there with my group of 9.

I just want to express how much we loved our server, Elijah. He is very charismatic and attentive, he was on point with service, and his positive, friendly attitude made our night, especially because we work in the hospitality industry and see bad customer service so often that it's so refreshing to see good service. We definitely plan on returning just based on Elijah!

I'm leaving a review for the service for two visits, not a review for the food. We were supposed to go to the Red Robin at Lakeforest before they closed, but I didn't like the fact that it was in the mall and I didn't want to go to the mall, so we came here instead. Boy, I wish we went to the mall one... Our server came and took our drink orders and brought them back. However, she didn't come back to take our food order. My husband was like did she forget about us? Thirty minutes later, another server came by and took our order and said our server was talking to the manager. Ok... Do that during your break or when you don't have customers. She brought our food, no apology, and checked up on us after that. All our drinks were from the bottomless menu and not one refill. I only ordered a dessert because of the offer for free dessert if at least $10 or more was spent. The cheesecake she brought us looked nothing like the one on the menu: no whipped cream, strawberries, or berry sauce, just the cheesecake. Our server said only one offer could be used; we were redeeming my birthday burger offer as well. If I was gonna spend $6+ for a slice of cheesecake, I can get one from the Cheesecake Factory. I wouldn't have minded paying for it either, if it came with all the toppings. I don't remember how much my husband tipped, but I hope it wasn't his usual 18-20%. Came back again for my daughter's 3rd birthday. It was either here or Outback because I had a 20% off entire bill for both places. Anyway, I called the day before and whoever took my call said they can't guarantee my reservation. Got there the next day and the hostess was like we don't take reservations, after I said I called the day before. Ok, you don't have to be rude about it. I should've just turned around and called everyone that we're going to Outback instead. Whoever took my call should've said they don't take reservations. Yes, I should've checked Yelp too. Anyway, took them awhile to get tables together for 18 adults (another came later) and 3 kids. They did a long table (there was only 2 ways out for people sitting inside to go to the restroom) and a booth. Bad setup. The two pros for the server: She got us fries immediately and gave us 10% off our bill. The red royalty card took off one free item. I didn't bring everyone here for one person to get a free burger. I gave my daughter the choices and she picked here. Don't think she knows, but whatever. We took her to Chuck E. Cheese on her real birthday. This was her celebration with the family. The server said they have no control over which offer is used. I had set the 20% off entire bill as my top offer too. But probably when she swiped my card, the 10th item free got priority. That's why our server gave us 10% off entire bill. Again, I ordered a bottomless drink, no refills. Just take those drinks off that menu if there's no refills. My end of the table didn't get any fresh fries. Only the first basket. My brother-in-law got a totally different burger than what he ordered. I said send it back, but he declined. I also don't know who ordered what, so there could've been items on there that no one ordered. I did count the entrees and there was the right amount. Don't know about apps and drinks. Two guests also didn't order an entree, just an appetizer to share. I'm definitely not dining in there ever again. The hubby can order food to go.

I don't know why this place has terrible reviews but we went anyway since the Lakeforest Mall location closed. Tear! Our waitress was Cassie. She was quick and attentive, and the place was clean (not that I thought it wouldn't be). The fried pickles and burgers were delish. It's a little further from home but we'll be frequent flyers here just like we were at Lakeforest. Don't take the reviews completely to heart, and try them for yourself! #yummmmmmmm

I don't know why the other reviews are so low but our experience was pretty good.  Our server was friendly and very helpful.  My granddaughters were happy, too.  This is our second time at the Germantown Red Robin and I have no complaints.  We will be back.

Love that they have boca burgers, that part is awesome. However, although service is wonderfully friendly, inaccuracies in the order, leaf lettuce requested but received shredded, and the lack of speed when it comes to receiving drinks, specifically shakes, is terribly inconsistent. Not huge hang ups, but definitely room for improvement.
Wait superrrrrrrr long. Took forever, waited for over an hour and food didn't come. Was during lunch.
Haven't been here in years, and I will never go back. The bartender never checked back after a runner dropped my burger. When she handed me my check she said" here you go".

This review is based off a Sunday lunch at the Red Robin in Germantown, MD. My friend and I often come here and have faced the reoccurring problem of bad service; particularly in the bar area. Although this time started off the same, it got a little better. Before we get into the service however, I just want to comment on everything else. The decor and cleanliness of this Red Robin is pretty good and consistent. The hosts/hostesses are always nice and welcoming and generally, there are a lot of different TV show options...assuming that is something you care about in the bar area.  The food and drinks we ordered were also good and timely. We both ordered the MADLOVE burger and it was perfectly cooked medium, with a balanced portion of toppings. The sauces we requested were added to the plate for our fries which were always fresh, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  Now for the service. I should first say that the bartender is, and has always been nice. Most of the time we come in here we sit in the bar to watch sports, or in this case, the Olympics, and the problem always seem to be in the bar but not because of her attitude. Simply put, there is always one bartender who services the restaurant and all the tables in the bar. Why this is the case I have no clue because I have seen the bartender try to make all the drinks for the tables in the restaurant and tend to the patrons at the bar, but in my experiences, this only spells out mayhem. I dont blame the bartender as much either but rather management for having this be such a persistent problem. I also see it in other peoples comments of this location. Anyways, the bartender took a long time to get to us originally to ask what we wanted to drink and when she finally did, you can tell she was in a rush to get to the other customers. So she takes our drinks, and doesnt come back with them until way later, which at this point, we ordered our food through the manager who had brought us some fries to snack on because she was taking long. After we ordered our food, we got our drinks and didnt see her again until the end of the meal. At this point, I saw the managers be more present in this area. I guess they caught on that she needed help and they often came and checked on us. This is where the service progressed with the managers essentially taking the role of a server and was steady until we asked for our check.  So 3.5/5 (because I cant do half stars) stars for good food, friendly staff and the service pickup by the managers. I took one star away because this is a consistent problem which clearly hasn't been fixed by management (kind of a paradox huh) and a half star away for half the bad service we received at this location. I hope this helps and I also hope they get there stuff together!

Wasnt greeted and no one came to our table. Had to find the manager to let them know no one had come to our table. Manager was quick to resolve issue but this wasnt the first time this has happened. Makes you feel some type of way. On top of that they werent busy at the time. Service was very slow

The service has gotten better here and so has the food. I was always a big fan of their burgers and bottomless steak fries, but the menu has expanded now to include even more burger options (even some healthier ones), milkshakes, spiked milkshakes, mixed drinks, and desserts. So many recently menu items are unique to Red Robin and I'm pleasantly surprised.  Drinks: The cupcake milkshake is simple but amazing. The Merry Moscato Punch is awesome and I didn't know until recently that it's being discontinued. I'm always on the lookout for moscato mixed drinks and I had never found one, let alone a good one, until I came to Red Robin. But apparently I got the last one. So disappointing! Please bring it back. Food: Get the onion ring tower or chips and guac/tomatoes as an appetizer. The Whiskey River BBQ burger is so yummy. So are the Burnin' Love and Sauteed 'Shroom burgers. You can't go wrong with the bottomless steak fries. Try the new different dipping sauces - they're 75 cents extra but totally worth it.

The food was great and the service was lacking. After coming off a 5 day only vegetable and fruit smoothie cleanse I was in the mood for a greasy burger to start the weekend off. I got the Royal Red Robin burger with the garlic fries. Our waitress was nice but slow with the bottomless fries. Also, my wife and I have only gone to a Red Robbin over 10 years ago; it would have been nice if she would have explained the menu or had recommendations. The burger and fries were on point though.

The service was aweful as in THERE WAS NO SERVICE! Was never waited on, mind you I had my 21 month yr old and mother with me, just sitting there like what the freak. So, after 20 mins, baby getting ansy, mother catching real attitude over wait, watching 2 families that were waiting for seating behind us in line be freaking serviced....bs We asked to speak to manager and he tried to apologize and say it was a miss and wanted us to do a lunch with 50% off.....by then I was done from dealing with calming my baby and rolled the freak out! Won't be going back to ANY Red Robins ever as all my experiences at any location, Atlanta, Delaware and Maryland have been horrible!

Well, if you are in the mood for kind of overpriced low average burgers, but admittedly tasty fries delivered after you have eaten the rest of your meal,  Red Robin will do you. I was always interested in trying this chain out, so our family of four, two kids under 8 and two parents tried it out tonight.  Food took about 20 plus minutes, was lukewarm at best, and bottomless fries proved a misnomer, when they never actually bring you any after the first limp serving.   The flavor of the sweet potato fries however was good, and when we eventually received our second helpings of steak and sweet potato fires, they were fresh, and definitely tasty.  I was supposed to be charged an extra $1.49 for the sweet taters, but I am not sure it appeared on our bill so that was nice considering the barely noticeable guacomole on the two burgers we ordered, one of which actually had guacamole in the name on the menu.  I couldn't even really taste any guacamole.   One plus is the kids meals which are reasonably priced, and our kids seemed to enjoy but the $2.99 milkshakes tasted like they are made with really crappy ice cream.  However, when it comes to families with kids, the biggest issue has not to do with the food, but the borderline reprehensible practice of leaving a game boy like monitor on each table, foisting them on unsuspecting parents with no mention from host, server or explanation on the video screen of a $1.99 charge.  While the manager was pleasant enough when asked about this practice, and did remove one charge, his attitude seemed to indicate that he knows this is a problem and others have complained, but Red Robin isn't interested in doing a thing about it.

We have been here so many time because my son like to eat here, so many time service has been really poor but today was the drop that over fill the glass. *service: poor as ever *food: 20 min late and supper  cold * we called the Manager "Kevin" we explain everything we got offered some  free coupons "if we come back" ( those were the server words) we left then on the table. They were " suppose to take 20 dollars of the bill, which when we give our card to the server to splinted in 2 he end up charging the whole amount from the bill.  I was not waiting for any free food  or anything but at least to get a good service and a good dinner after a log day of work, i tryed to spending some family time. Witch did not happen, never coming back, even if my son ask me for it.
The food was great service was amazing our Server Dayone provided the best service I highly recommend him. He was very generous with the bottomless fries and he was very attentive.

Oh Red Robin, how I have such a love/hate relationship with thee! I went here on a Friday evening around 5p or so, right before the dinner rush.  We were seated promptly, sitting in the bar area per our request. Our server was the bartender and had I realized that prior to our ordering, I would have requested a new table. He was obviously very busy trying to make drinks for the restaurant, serve those sitting at the bar as well as those around him at the bar tables. Consequently, he paid very little attention to us during our meal. He was pleasant when he did come around, it was just obvious that he was spread too thinly and it affected his ability to perform good service. Additionally, there were multiple flies/gnats in the bar area. I suspect it likely was due to cut up fruit at the bar, but, annoying and gross regardless.  We also had an issue with my Red Robin Royalty card. Our server did bring the manager over because he couldn't figure it out and she provided us with the discount despite being able to run the card. She also provided us with information on how to get the card/account fixed. Overall, I felt like there were attempts to provide good service but that was overshadowed by our over-sat server. Likely will patronize another Red Robin prior to returning here.

The kids like it.  The bottomless sides are nice.  The service is usually poor but friendly. It's kind of random if your food or service will be good each time you go. Some of the items are very good, others look nothing like the menu pictures.   I got a Black & Bleu burger last night.  The menu showed it piled with mushrooms and overflowing with blue cheese crumbles.   My burger had a couple mushroom slices on it and the small pile of blue cheese in the center.  It was $15!   (Okay, maybe $14.89 or something...but ridiculously below average for the surcharge over a standard burger there which is around $9.) The bottomless sides are nice, when you get them.  When you are there with the family you likely only have time for one refill at most since sometimes they come by and check, sometimes they don't, sometimes they completely forget to bring it when you order it.   You can't really rely on diving into piles and piles of delicious fried potato goodness...you know, if nobody actually brings any. It's better than fast food though and I don't feel guilty if the kids are loud.  It also does not have the shady element of El Mexicano place across the street.

Probably the best burger I've had in months however my mood was dampened by not getting any napkins or silverware until I was almost half done with my meal. Maybe if my server/bartender hadn't been giving free drinks and socializing with her friend I wouldn't have had to wait over 20 minutes for my check. Overall awful service but great burger.

I wish the one in Lake Forest didn't close. The food here is fine. Burgers are good and the fries are definitely something to look forward to. However, the service is really bad. We probably waited for 20 minutes before we were greeted. We were so hungry that we were ready to order by the our waitress greeted us. After that, it took about 40 more minutes for the food to come. I just don't think that's acceptable. Maybe they were busy that day, but from other reviews, it seems that the service is bad no matter what. I don't really think I'll come here again until I see in the reviews that the service is getting better. For now, I'll have to find another nice burger place. =(

I first ate at Red Robin in Seattle Washington. I spent a lot of time in that fair city for work, and often had evenings free where a reasonably priced meal was, well much needed.  The one in Germantown is located near the Germantown Regal theaters and in a cluster of restaurants around the Fairfield Inn, right off the bypass. We started the meal off with the tower of Onion rings. Always a good starting point for any meal. They are amazing as they always are! We then moved to the main course. I had the AvoCobb salad. A really nice mix of greens and other items. Tasty and well prepared. I do have to say our server was amazing! He was very quick and kept the table clear. I ended up with the Salted Caramel Sea Salt Malt. That was worth the visit right there. It is nice to be able to share a part of my former life (traveling) with my family. There were no Red Robins in Indiana so its nice to go and remember what was. The place is always packed. Both boys had burgers. They have in their many visits pronounced the burgers amazing. Luke actually tried the chili cheese fries and was quite happy. My wife had a teriyaki chicken salad.  Nick had a shake as well. We had a fun conversation explaining what a malt was to Nick. Luke split a dessert with Barb (some chocolate dipped thing).
They used to be one of my favorite burger spots, but throughout the years they've slowly deteriorated. They've become less clean/presentable & the staff have been rude.

I came here on a Friday night around 7 pm. I got seated in the bar area pretty quickly. The food took a long time to come out, my bacon wasn't even fully cooked on the burger. I had to wait almost 15 minutes for a refill on my drink. The server did not communicate anything. I then asked for more fries and waited another 15 minutes to get a couple of fries. The server was lucky my boyfriend paid because I wouldn't have tipped her $1. I will never visit Red Robin again.

A week ago I ordered a meal to go and the lady gave me my burger with no bread..  Unfortunately I was on my way to work when I realized that my burger had no bun. Terrible..  The only good thing about this place, is that they have bottomless fries.
Food is okay - management is HORRIBLE!  They can't seem to keep things under control when it gets busy, and they treat their staff poorly in front of customers!

I love this place bc their burgers are delicious and the unlimited fries are a bargain.  however, the service here is terrible and slow !  We waited 30 minutes just to get waitress attention just to order more fries and water. The waitresses look inexperienced and keep telling us "hold on, i'll be right back" and the manager seems careless about this place. Love the food, hate the service here. Make sure you plan ahead if you plan on coming here. Expect to wait forever ! :)

Let me start by saying the food here is actually pretty good. That is where the niceties end. I live in town and have been to this particular Red Robin many times. I have also spent many years working in the food service industry. That being said, the service at this specific Red Robin is atrocious from the host stand to the management. The restaurant is eternally understaffed, resulting in extremely slow and poor service. The hosts are typically uninterested and apathetic when dealing with guests. The wait staff is always spread thin and inattentive. On our most recent trip to the restaurant, our waitress  (who was actually quite nice and professional) made an error and charged my card with another table's bill (which was more expensive than ours) unbeknownst to me. On our way out of the restaurant we were stopped by a Manger who informed us that there had been an error in processing our bill. She initially tried to play this off as a simple error, which I can relate to. After about 10 minutes it was brought to our attention that yet another error was made in processing our payment. When asked about the situation the Manger in question became hostile and extremely unhelpful and rude. Thanks to this woman I am going to have to closely monitor my credit card statements for the next few months to ensure all is in order. At no time did anyone take the time to apologize for the error. Take my advice and drive up the road to Applebees if you're looking for a somewhat decent casual dining chain in Germantown.
