I will give this place one star but the food was halfway decent. We come in our waiter is very unattentive more interested in helping another table than any of his other three took 25 minutes just to get an order of fries and another 20 minutes just to get the drinks sausage took another 15 to 20 minutes all in all we spent about more than an hour just waiting on the things that we actually ordered none-the-less my girlfriend's Burger was cooked medium well more like medium vs. Well done like she asked we have to speak to a manager and he didn't even look interested and even getting the manager in the first place all in all this place needs better leadership would not recommend

As with a typical chain restaurant, sometime you won't know what you'll be getting. However, with this middle of the week evening visit we found the food and service was good. Our wait staff was very friendly and prompt with the service, was very patient while we go through the long extensive menu. Today we opt with burgers only. The Prime Chophouse patty was done perfectly, loaded with onion straws and sauteed mushrooms with hint of horseradish. Guacamole Bacon with slab of guacamole and bacon strips over flown from the patty. The Banzai burger topped with grille pineapple gives you a refreshing bite from the heavy taste of the burger. Another offer I like RR is the choice of dipping sauce with your fries, instead of "Would you like ketchup with your fries?". And shakes are always a good choice here.     Only negative I saw today was while walking past the kitchen area, saw a puddle of standing water on the floor they never cleaned even when we were leaving. If you have an open kitchen area, please keep it clean so the customers won't gross out.
If you are lucky enough to get Ellisa for your bartender, you are in for a treat. Great drinks & witty conversation. Worth it.

This review is based off 2 times dining at this location.  The first time we had a party of 5 and they had to remake 3 of our orders.  They burned a burger to a black crisp and still served it.  The bacon was old and dry as cardboard.  Not one time did the manager come to apologize.   I sent a email to Red Robin corporate and was given a $30 coupon to come back.  We came back and the food and service was no better.  Our appetizer was brought after our meal, and our drinks even slower.     Save your money and time here are better burgers and better service out there.

Horrible horrible horrible me and my bf gave this place two tries and both have been horrible the waiters are Extremely slow ! Don't care and the whole staff made us feel unwanted and uncomfortable p.s we where sitting at the bar area the only thing nice I have to say is the hostess was sweet ! But nevertheless absolutely the worst atmosphere We have ever had to experience! Anywho now on to the food One. There was a fly in my drink ewwww the waiter did give me a new one the funny part is he didn't seem surprised (this probably happens a lot ) two I asked for my burger well done I can't eat meat if it's not absolutely well done and I could of sworn they cut up some meat in the back and forgot to cook the burger and just put it in between the buns sigh... I hate to complain but this place I literally can't stand even looking at anymore if you even want a burger I think your even better off at mcdonalds or Wendy's for that matter okay end of the story !   Red Robin goodbye for good I never want to step foot in any of your burger chains ever again yuckkkkkkkkk oh wait did I almost forget to mention the hair on my plate ...

Tonight service was the freaking worst. My children and I went to Red Robin last week. GREAT SERVICE; but tonight I had the worst waitress she came over with a little attitude no smile on her face, she did not offer any refills once we were done with our drinks, she did not check on us after our appetizer was brought out by a different waitress. We wait a while for our food and it wasn't crowded while all the staff was in the kitchen laughing out loud. When you good finally came out it was cold. The manager came over I explained my concerns to her and she wasn't no help either. My family and I will not be return here for a while. THE WORST SERVICE TONIGHT

Josh ROCKS! Our food was SoOo delicious. He was right on top of our table. We didn't have to ask for anything, and we didn't have to look for him. He showed us how to pay at the table and everything. The overall experience has forced me to plan on returning. THANK YOU SO MUCH JOSH. WE WILL BE BACK!

Red Robin as a chain is generally very good. This location? Ehhhh.  I have only been here maybe four times but each time there has been a reoccurring theme for what goes wrong. Like coming here a few months ago, and having the waitress rudely cut off my boyfriends dad mid sentence (see previous review). But, this was a while ago so I came in with my boyfriend and his dad again, and was hoping for a better experience.  Previous times my boyfriend has come here, with and without me, he has specified "no mayo" and "no onions" on his burger. And without fault, every single time it still came back with mayo and onions on it. This time, I watched the waitress specifically write and underline "no mayo/onions", and both him and his dad specifically mentioned please no mayo/onions, as previous times this has been ignored. Without fault, the burger comes, with mayo and onions!!!  Our waitress was great, very nice the entire time and happily brought the burger back and got him a proper one. I dont think it's a problem with this waitress, or any really, but the cooks. When you're dealing with ingredients that could be potential allergens, it would be nice if a simple direction could be followed.  I love Red Robin, and it sucks because this is the only one near me. But if the patterns I've seen keep happening, I may have to cut my losses.

Let me start off by saying that i've been here twice in the past couple months and have been pleasantly pleased with service and overall quality of my experience.   I came here with my boyfriend on Saturday around 6:30pm and found about 20 people in the lobby so i already knew that there would be a wait, but when i walked into the bar there were 5 tables that were open that were just waiting to be cleaned.  I asked the hostess if we could sit there and she said that she would get someone to clean then off and that wouldn't be a problem.  Mind yo, that never happened.  The bartender asked if she could help and she eventually had to come from behind the bar and ended up moving all glassware and plastic plates to the next table so we could sit.  She didn't really clean it, she just moved everything from one table to the next so we could sit.  Our server came and greeted us and got our drink order and proceed to come back with a tall blue moon for my boyfriend and a lipstick covered glass of wine for me.  I had to send it back and then was brought a clean glass.  Really?  We ordered an appetizer (pretzel bites) and 2 burgers, i ordered a cheeseburger with mushrooms . Ten minutes go by and our server brought us our burgers, and when i explained to her that we never got our app she went back to the kitchen and came back with this explanation "that part of our kitchen is backed up, would you still like your appetizer?". First, that should have been explained when i ordered the appetizer, not after the fact.  Is there absolutely no communication with the kitchen and the staff????? My burger was missing the cheese and the mushrooms so she, again, had to go back and fix her mistake.  When she came back again she said "we usually charge extra for those kinds of toppings but we ended up giving that to you for free".  Wow.  Needless to say, our experience was below average and we made a decision that this would be our last time.  I did see a manager walking around but i saw her on the kitchen line playing around with the staff. There should have been 2 managers there that night, one at the host stand and one at the back of the house walking around to eat table greeting the guests, maybe even helping the overwhelmed staff.  This isn't rocket science, but somehow McDonalds seems like a better option at this point. Don't waste your time or money on this place, it's a disappointment and not worth it.

Hey I don't know what it is with this place but clearly something somewhere has gone downhill. If this please continue to serve people crap I'm gonna stink bomb place back to the Stone Age as a message of protest. First off we don't need these tablets out on these tables. Loose the tablets why do we need them. To torture our eyes. People already get plenty of screen time we don't need these tablets WTF LOOSE THE MOBILE TABLETS. So just like when I said at green turtle when you're serving your customers and you provide them your drink and they're done with their drink you need to ask if they want more of their drink not automatically refill their drink without their permission - flood their table with beverages that they do not ask for I should not be telling this place how to run their establishment. It's pathetic food here it's OK though but I believe the old red Robin was better.

Wow...Red Robbin's are usually super places to grab a burger, but last night I had one of the worst experiences at this restaurant. Firstly let's start with the front of the store...mayhem...that's the only way to describe it. Basically the right hand had no idea what the left hand was doing so I opted to eat at the bar which proved to be equally as challenging. The bartender, albeit nice, had the personality of a cocktail napkin...which he neglected to give me when he served my drink in a dirty glass...you could see a film of something (probably an improperly washed/rinsed glass). I sent that back and went a safer route asking for a bottle of beer. After having to wave this young man down, twice, I placed my order. While waiting I hit the restroom to wash my hands and left there feeling as though I needed a shower. You can tell a lot about an establishment by merely walking in the bathroom. I shudder to think what the kitchen must look like judging by the condition of the restroom. But I digress...shortly after returning to the bar my luke-warm burger showed up on yes, a dirty plate. I vacillated on whether to send that back, but thought that was unwise and bit the bullet. The burger was tasty and went well with the 7 steak fries that came with....yup, I counted them...7 of them. I hope this place gets its act together; I'm sure I'm not the only one who's had this type of complaint...experienced management at this particular restaurant is severely lacking. Maybe a visit by the health department would wake the franchisee up.

Food is decent, service is slow. Staff seemed preoccupied with one another at times. But the thing that got me the most was how dirty the kitchen looked. My table had a direct view and it got worse and worse as time passed. I saw manager and staff step over the trash on the floor for about 1hr. I even took a picture. Definitely was a big turnoff.

The only reason I would give this 3 stars is for the food. As soon as we got there, we were greeted promptly by the hosts and seated immediately.  The server came a couple minutes later and asked us what wanted to drink.  It took her over 10 minutes to bring us two waters.  After 10 minutes of waiting I pressed the "call server" button on the tablet they have on table but that didn't get her attention.  When she finally came back with the waters she informed us that the call button isn't working. Like always, I ordered the Royal Red Robin with fries and it was perfect.  The burger and egg was perfectly cooked and fries with the campfire sauce topped it off.  I will definitely go back to this restaurant but I just hope the service improves.

I will preface this review by saying that the only reason why I dined at Red Robin was the unlimited steak fries. I heard about the unlimited fries through a commercial and being the steak fries lover that I am, I had to visit. We went on a weekend night, so perhaps that was our first mistake. Upon walking into the restaurant, we saw a huge wait and we were informed that there would be at least a 30-minute wait. We persevered and were seated next to a large group of raucous teenagers, who deeply made me rethink having my own children one day. The service was literally nonexistent. Perhaps it was because the restaurant was incredibly busy (let me give him the benefit of the doubt), but we rarely saw our waiter. Whenever we were miraculously able to get a hold of him, we would desperately request for more fries and drinks. Then we would see our order appear 20+ minutes later. Because of how long the service was taking (and my patience thinning each second), our unlimited fries and bottomless beverage wasn't exactly "unlimited." Avoid the weekend nights. If you are so inclined to dine here, try to make it during their off-hours (after lunch rush on a week day).
Many burger choices,in fact a confusing menu that I never completely comprehended. Service was great but food only okay
Food is always delicious and fresh! Love the Towering Onions and the Banzai burgers. The freckled strawberry lemonade is a favorite of my kids.

Food was fine but the waitress' were petty. They accused my friends and I of lying about my friends birthday. Regardless, why do they doubt a customer's integrity over a dessert? It was extremely offensive. More accusations were made than the actual serving. They ended up charging me for the desserts and I asked why. They said that I was lying about their birthdays. Worse costumer service ever! I ended up paying for one of the desserts because I just wanted to leave. The manager was very nice and understanding. Just a few bad waitress'.

Just had lunch there and it was busy but still that didn't explain the poor service. Hamburgers finally arrived for 3 of our party but not my grilled chicken salad. Twice I asked about the salad I ordered. The other 3 had finished their meals before my salad arrived. I ended up taking it home. I asked our server to speak to the manager. She never did. We finally got our check and we needed to leave so I never did speak to the manager and there was no reduction on our bill for food I was unable to enjoy with the rest of my family. Unexcusable..

Burgers are huge and delicious. I usually go for the Royal Red Robin with fries. Food is really good and reasonably priced. Nice place to get a quick bite. Wait times vary but usually reasonable. We usually get decent service. On this particular visit the waitress we got had a really bad attitude.

If I could put a negative star, that would've been my choice.  Went there on Sunday around 3:30 pm so not a big lunch rush.  It took our waitress Melissa 25 minutes to serve the food for kids without any napkins and/or booster seat which we have asked for.  Another 20 minutes passed and our food was serviced, still no napkins, no booster seat for kids and no silverware for salads.  She did come by and said she forgot about it but didn't bring those over at all.  Finally had to talk to another waitress for basic supplies.  Please do yourself a favor and try to avoid.

We were hungry, they had food and were near the movies. Service (Olivia) was excellent, burgers were okay. Wish we didn't have such a view of the wide open kitchen entrance, which was not inviting (not very clean). Dining room can get very loud.

First of all I almost never give people bad reviews but this server wasn't just rude but lacked knowledge of the menu she argued with me about the burger I ordered!?!? These are the fries I received I will be calling her manager

I don't have high expectations when I go to Red Robin, but this wasn't a great experience.  We waited for 20 minutes after sitting before I flagged down an (assistant?) manager who took our drink orders. I told her we would like to order and she said she'd send someone to take our order while she got our drinks. She came back and ended up taking our order. I had a bite of my husbands dinner and came out with a hard piece of plastic that looked like it was chipped off something. No harm done, but sort of made me not want to eat anymore. She comped that meal and apologized. She was really very nice and the food was decent. They just seemed very unorganized and chaotic. It was busy, but a very busy area so I suspect they have a high volume of people on a regular basis.

Been to many Red Robin's. This was a busy place last evening. But not too busy to have wonderful service. All employees are so attentive to all guests there, whether they are your server or not. Manager was awesome. We had a little issue as we wanted our burgers well done. They came out not as well done as we like. Issue handled immediately, burger came out delicious.  Really felt our visit was appreciated by all staff. Different than some other Red Robin's. Much better! You will notice the difference. Great meal, great employees.

Disappointed. Very disappointed  . I feel like my money went down the drain.  I used to come to this establishment and had fell in love with their burgers. Everything used to be so good I don't know what happened.  The first hostess rudely said " be right with you" and I did not appreciate her attire. She had her shirt buttoned down and you could see her bra and cleavage. looked as though it was on purpose as if she wanted to lol sexy , which i don't think is appropriate for a restaurant. But the next hostess was nice polite  and walked us to our table.  At first I was not happy with our table because it was so close to another couple i felt too tight. the hostess noticed my displeasure and said I could move which i appreciated the gesture but it worked out for my daughters booster seat. At least everything was clean but we did not have any silverware on our table.I really hate it and it's a bad sign if you have to ask for it upon arrival and sitting.  Service? Non existent. Our waitress was nice but barely saw her. Waited FOREVER for our drinks and food. When we needed something it was brought but almost impossible to find someone to help even with the call server button. The food itself? BLAND AND NASTY. my turkey burger was salty, nachos bland, beans bland, my daughters meatballs bland, just ugh. aim glad i didn't order anything fattening because i would've been triple disappointed . I have a nasty after taste. Ruined my mood and sunday. So upset.

Red Robin is a good burger joint.   I like to get my burger in a lettuce wrap instead of bread.  Also, I can get fruit instead of the bottomless fries, when I want to.  It is kinda loud, but if you know that going in to it you'll be fine.  It's great for kids and there is always big groups, especially on the weekends.  I only gave them 4 stars because occasionally they get our carry out order wrong.  They are happy to make it right, but I suggest you check the order before leaving the restaurant.

If you value your time never order carry out or Grubhub from this location. when I get there nobody acknowledges my presence even though it's not very busy and they have a lot of staff. One hostess just points and tells me to wait over there. 10 min later someone finally checks my order... wasn't even started yet... The reason my story is vague is because this is happened at least five times now. I wouldn't even care if they were nice to me about it but they just ignore me and then finally tell me oh it's going to be about 15 minutes no apologies nothing. They don't value your time you shouldn't value their product.

I came by yesterday with a couple of friends, we started out with two appetizers and some drinks. Appetizers were fine. Bartender was amateur but not bad. Managers and crew were laughing and talking to each other while my food was taking 45 minutes to make. My food was dead cold and not appetizing. Disgusting. I can make a better burger at home smh. Lol never again. I recommend hiring a new kitchen staff. Avoid this place and go to Longhorn.

I have been to this Red Robin twice since I have been in town, and both times I was completely underwhelmed.  With a slogan like "Red Robin, Yummmmm!" You would expect much better. A more appropriate slogan may be "Red Robin, Ummmmmm I should have went somewhere else."  Took forever to get our food the second time we went.  Half the beers on tap were unavailable, and the local beer that they did have that was available tasted like straight hops. Needless to say I was not hoppy with my beer.  The burger I ordered which was the sriracha burger was a disappointment, because it does not have sriracha sauce on it.  The fries were fairly good though.  But the whole experience is my fault because I wanted beer with my burger.  If I had just abstained from wanting a beer I could have had a delicious burger from Five Guys, Burger King, or Wendy's.   In summary if you want good fries this is the place to go.  If you want a particular beer be prepared to settle for a not so good one.  And if you are perfectly satisfied with disappointment then their burgers are for you!  The staff was very nice though. So fries and staff are a positive experience.

Food was decent. The garlic fries were very good but soggy. My daughter ordered a blta and a shake.  They totally forgot the shake and had to reorder it. It took over 20 minutes to get it. Her sandwich was supposed to have avocado and the amount that was on it was a joke. Her bread was also broken and made it hard to eat. Service was horrible. When we for our plate, my daughter told them to go ahead and put in for more broccoli since it was also bottomless. After the waitress finally appeared later, we had to order it again as it never showed. Then we had to order it a third time. Just trying to get the waitress so we could order more fries was a huge waste of time. Honestly, they can afford bottomless because they never show up to allow you to reorder.

Ordered take-out and all of the order-specific requests wrong (specific toppings and side-dish alternative). When I got home and discovered the mistake I called the manager who was very accommodating in offering either the corrected meal or a credit upon my next visit.  Admittedly they were already geographically inconvenient so I haven't taken them up on the offer.

I have eaten at at least 8 different Red Robin Restaurants including an out of state one in Birmingham, Alabama. This location gives all the other Red Robin restaurants I have frequented a very bad name.  I will never eat at this one again.  I brought my out-of- state son, and my grandchildren and daughter-in-law to this location because it was close to the Germantown Rec Center where we had left from and the grandchildren wanted to eat there.  The waiter was just okay but the lady who brought the food to us was over the top rude, ignorant, and inpatient.  There was a Latino family sitting next to us and she was not much better than that with them.  She brought the food out to us and impatiently and rudely shouted the first few items out.  She then shouted rudely," who has a mostly pink and a little pink and no pink?" She did not even end the question with a noun like "burger." All  three adults at the table were not understanding her request at first, she rudely shouted it again.  I said to my table guests, "who ordered medium rare, medium well, or well done?  It then clicked to all my guests that is what she meant by "pink" but I gather she thought none of us were intelligent enough to figure out the real way to ask our cooking choice for the burgers.  We all eat out on a regular basis, including the grandchildren and at better places than Red Robin.  I had French onion soup which is my favorite soup and it was the worst French Onion soup I have ever tasted in my life and I order French Onion Soup a lot from many restaurants.  This female who came from the kitchen is in the wrong career and if she made the soup, she definitely should give it up.  Bad experience overall.  The Sprite that three people ordered was just seltzer water and it took 3 requests and 15 minutes later before the third request was honored by a young man who was not waiting on us. I flagged him down because people were thirsty.  I tipped the wait person 20% only because both my now adult sons at some point waited tables and have done other jobs in the restaurant business.  I showed compassion because it certainly was not 20% service.  If it was left up to the lady who brought the food to us to also have been our server, I would have left nothing for a tip.  For me to take the time a day later out of my busy schedule to write a negative complaint on any business means that I am still very pissed off to have spent my money and been treated as such. If I had been by myself and this happened, I would have just left.  I did not want to disappoint my guests, so I sucked it up.  I spend my money where I feel respected. This treatment deserved 0 stars but that choice was not available.

Where do I start? This is the 4th time in 10 months that we have eaten at RR, (we used to go monthly), and every single time the food was wring and it terrible. 2 times the service was terrible.   This time, they had repaired the roof the night before, and rather than close the restaurant, they stayed open.  The only seats that didn't include the horrible propane-like smell were taken,  (6 tables). We asked to move and the manager said we would have the smell everywhere.  We had a headache before the food arrived. My daughter ordered a smoothy, (frozen strawberries, for $1.99 extra), but got a milkshake instead, ($2.99 extra, on top of the kids' meal). Her fruit cup was a combo of frozen strawberries and canned fruit, and was in a little black condiment cup! The menu shows a bowl of each side. It is the same size bowls used for the adult sides. This was about 1/4 the size of the white bowl. .  My order was missing the crumbled blue cheese. I ordered a black and blue burger, but it came with a white cheese sauce, and no blue cheese crumbles. I did not want a bun, so when I saw the actual burger, I was shocked at how small it was! I paid  $14.95 for a black and blue, yet my husband paid  $10.95 for a mushroom swiss burger, which actually had more meat and toppings.  The container of fries was tiny, holding 9 fries. I asked for more and got a basket of them, but they were the only item that tasted as expected.  I contacted corporate last time, and took 30 min to thoroughly fill out the online survey, but never heard another word! I contacted them using their Facebook page, and was told to take the survey! We used to live at RR, because we could take our kids and everyone left happy and full.   This was a very expensive meal that nobody liked. $43 for 2 waters, an adult SIDE  sized bowl of mac and cheese, a ketchup cup of canned/frozen fruit, a handful of French fries, a small bowl of broccoli,  a tiny burger with some white cheese on it, a fruit smoothy, and a burger with lots of meat, mushrooms, and Swiss cheese! Needless to say, we will not go back again!

Horrible new management. Poor customer service. Waiter forgot to bring the appetizer and brought it to us after we had the food. She asked the manager to see if we can get a discount and the manager said no. I was shocked ! The appetizer was gross just took a spoon and left it cause it was poor and we were full already. We r not going back. I always liked that place but new management sucks.
Average crowd, had to ask 3 times for a glass of water. Never had the opportunity to get a second glass of wine, never saw the waiter. Food was as expected, nothing special.

Stopped in for lunch on October 9, 2017 on the way back from a long weekend in North Carolina. Quite expensive for what you get in terms of portion size and quality. We ordered two soft drinks, chicken tenders/fries, and the soup/salad combo.  Total before tip was $28.   The chicken tenders were ok as were the fries but the salad dressing, blue cheese, was weaker then bottled dressing.  Salad size was an average side salad.  The Clam Chowder was thin with very little clams and potatoes.  Portion size was equal to a cup. Manager walked by our table several times, once stopping to talk with table behind us, but never checked in with us. Overall my last visit to a Red Robin.  Should have gone across the parking lot to Longhorn and gotten better food for about the same amount of money.

Back here again and ordered the A1 burger medium rare.   Like last time in my opinion, the burger was just not good, in my opinion.  I got halfway through and stopped eating it.  It almost tasted too sweet and was filled with junk.  The flavor of the beef was non-existent; making me almost feel sick, so I stopped eating it.   Ugh, now I have a stomach ache.  Just stick with the Jim Beam and Cokes (they do free pour their drinks)and forget their burgers.

I like RR for a nice family restaurant. But this location is by far the worse one I have ever been too. Incompetent staff. Today I went in to place a to-go order and the bartender wouldn't take my order then I went to the hostess and there were 2. Both ingored me until I spoke up and asked to place an order. Then one disappeared after saying something about checking on how to take the order. After 5 mins a manager appeared, and took my order. 25mins later I finally just left without food because I was annoyed about how long it was taking and how rude everyone is there. Not my first bad experience there.

I wish I could write a positive review... over the past 3 months or so we have come at least once a month.. and the service is just not good.  Should have learned my lesson after the ants incident.  Our table was infested with ants.  Not just on the table but they were on our bodies as well.  Gross.  But we gave it another chance the service was more or less non existent.  Came to take our order, and put our food down. Didn't see them until we were done.  And yesterday our sever took our order someone else brought our appetizer someone else brought our food but not one of them refilled our drinks.  Our waitress was more interested in chatting with a couple of her coworkers she didn't even notice we got up and left after waiting about 15 minuets after we were done with our food.  Thank goodness for the little table thing where you can pay.   Will definitely not be going back.

This place has, unfortunately, gone directly into the gutter.  What used to be a well-run, clean, and tasty experience has truly fallen on bad times.  Hostesses have absolutely no idea what they are doing.  It takes them a ridiculous amount of time to determine if they even have available tables for arriving customers.  Once seated, we have watched as tables with trash and leftovers have sat untouched by any worker for over half an hour.  During the same half hour, we watched at least half a dozen servers literally stepping on food that was on the floor instead of cleaning it up.  We have been served burnt burgers with cold french fries and sat and waited for a refill on s drink for 15 minutes while attempting to eat our meal.  We have talked to management on multiple occasions to let them know our concerns and refuse to take anything the restaurant offers as a monetary apology.  It's not about the money, the whole experience is terrible.  We've gone back a few times in the hopes that our concerns would be addressed...with no success.  The place has gotten even worse.  Avoid it and go somewhere else where your business would be appreciated. You'll than us.

I have to agree that the service here is not good. This used to be a favorite for us, but you will have better luck at five guys up the street if you are looking for a good burger with fries. I am not exactly sure why the place has declined so badly over the past years. The burgers are still okay, but not worth the poor customer service.

What is wrong with this place?? After waiting 20 minutes for our waitress to return to check on us after dropping our food off, we used their fancy call button (a flashing light on that tablet checkout thing on their tables). 5 minutes later she noticed the light and strolled back to the table. As we hadn't been checked since we'd received our food, we had a few items to request (refills on our drinks, refill of my son's bottomless oranges, and a refill of the bottomless fries). She finally brought back my sons drink, then turned off the blinking light and walked away.  15 minutes later we left, having never seen our 'waitress' or requested again. She did walk by us plenty of times with other people's food. The only good part is that we could use their tablet thing to check out without waiting another 15 minutes. Hopefully our tip made a point, but i have a sneaking suspicion she didn't give a crap about that.

Our burgers were good but they skimped on the fires. Service was very bad; it was a Saturday night and they were slammed. We've been here in the week ans sat at the bar which helps with the service. The self order machine at our table did not work until we were paying the bill.

This Red Robin is awful. They make you wait 15 minutes and when you get seated you can see so many tables empty, meanwhile people are waiting to be seated. Absolutely ridiculous. And the waitress was a bit slow, my mom ordered cod fish and shrimp and they brought her chicken tenders and shrimp. It was 30 degrees outside and they had the AC on. This place is awful and we are not coming back.

1. Ambiance:  This is a fun and upbeat burger joint and I love the color scheme of the place. Red walls and tiles with fun patterned booths filled the restaurant. It is a casual restaurant and is a perfect place to spend time with friends/family while enjoying a great meal.  2. Food: This is an all you can eat french fries! Goodness, I am in heaven. However, I am not too crazy about their fries because it is quite big and not as crispy as I would like. It is a perfect place to carb load before a race though. I had ordered the Madlove Burger and had a food coma. The burger was humongous and the beef was so juicy with fresh toppings.  3. Service:  A star deduction for the service. The food took forever to come out and we were starving. It was not busy at all and I get it, perhaps there was a limited help in the kitchen. However, when the food came out, the server was not nice or apologetic. She also did not check up on us either.  4. Costs:  The burger costs $14.99, which is a lot for a burger. However, the portion is really big and it's all you can eat french fries! I hope that they can change up their french fries one day and get the really crispy kind.  5. Overall Experience:  Besides the service, I thought the food and decor were on the money. Perhaps the service was just an outlier of an incident, so I will make a visit later down the road if I need to carb load.  Side Notes: N/A

Showed up at 5pm on a Tuesday with my 3 kids. I hoped for a quick dinner. I waited in line to be seated. When we got to the hostess stand I was told it would be a 15 min wait because the section where they put "all that stuff" gesturing to my infant carrier was being cleaned and there was no place to seat us. My options were to wait or to get all 3 kids back into car seats and go to a different place. So much for a family friendly environment. Never again Red Robin, never again.

Rude and dismissive is the operative phrase here.   They treat delivery services here like crap.  They do not acknowledge you in a quick nor professional manner.  If this is how they treat people delivering their food, I can imagine how they treat customers.  I refuse to find out.
My pregnant girlfriend wanted red robin fries on her birthday. We were never seated. Stood at the front desk for 5 minutes while multiple waiters walked by

Red Robin has always been my go-to for burgers since In-N-Out can't be found on this side of the coast. I've never had a bad experience at this particular location but I was hoping that the service improved since my last visit. Food came out quick but the same old story with the service. I had to ask our waiter a few times to refill my water which I shouldn't have to do especially if I place it at the far edge of the table. A good server would refill the cups or bring out more drinks without being asked. The burger was made perfectly just how I like it and unlimited fries were delicious. Always ask for the campfire sauce as your dipping sauce, it has never failed me! My sister's order was okay except for the few pieces of sweet potato fries she had on her plate. The server saw our faces when he placed it on the table like...are you kidding me? He was nice enough to bring more out but again consistency is key. I hope to see some improvements the next time I visit.

We used to go often. Visited on a Thursday night, not filled to capacity, no wait, no staff seemed rushed. Server walked by after the usual amount of time and says he will be right with us. After enough time to memorize the menu he showed up to take our drink order. Our server had the personality of a cardboard box, no emotion, no energy. Our food came out in a decent amount of time, fries were just warm, tasted like grease. My wife said the burger had no flavor in the patty. My entire order was wrong, so wrong that it was as if the server grabbed the wrong sandwich. I sent it back. After a few mins, the server came to tell me that I got what I ordered and read back the order he wrote down only to realize he was wrong. I waited and watched my family finish their food because the remake took longer than the initial order did. The manager delivered the food, very dry demeanor, apologized and offered a free dessert. I felt like it was a 'run of the mill' apology, and he didn't care that they got it wrong or that I had to watch my family finish before I could eat. The manager even pre-bussed my table so that my plate was the only one left. The server never filled our drinks until we asked for it, during our free dessert. Based on this experience, Red Robin might soon be on my don't eat here ever again list. As a side note: we know shit happens sometimes, how you handle/recover from it is how you retain guests, not caring is how you lose them.

Stopped in for my free gourmet birthday burger & waited for a few minutes while no one seemed to be assigned to my table. Instead of turning into a bad situation, the staff & manager stepped up & I had 2-3 people helping or checking up on me. Although I never complained, they ended up covering my drink for the inconvenience. I was so impressed, I didn't even mention the free burger. So glad to see good customer service still exist.

This place has really gone downhill.  The servers have gotten unresponsive. My food obviously had been ready to get picked up from the kitchen, but the server didn't get around to it until the bottom bun had gotten soggy. She didn't check on us for refills even though she passed our table several times. I wound up putting "call server" light on to get a refill on the fries. She noticed the light after about 10 minutes. If we weren't hungry still, we would have given up on getting more fries because it took so long to get her attention. Those annoying payment systems on the table are slow and never print the check either.  I think I am done with this location. I used to eat here pretty frequently.

I'll start off by saying our server was so sweet and was always smiling. That's the only good thing I can say for our experience today.  Our server asked us what we wanted to drink and offered an appetizer; my husband and I ordered two beers, the dip "trio" and our daughters meal that is supposed to come with their choice of milk, juice, soda etc. We ordered her a milk that never came, my beer was apparently out, and the trio was basically one dish with a tiny bit of guacamole, salsa and corn salsa in each corner.  Our daughters meal came out first which we wanted, but still no milk. The side of fruit that is pictured on the menu looked fresh and plentiful, but when it came out, it was served in a to-go ramekin...? And looked like it had come from a can days before. My husband had ordered a second beer before the main course came out, but didn't get it until he was almost done with his meal. When our food did come out, my side salad that I ordered in place of fries was sitting right on the plate next to the burger and was warm and wilted due to the plate being hot. We could tell the plate had been in the window for a while before it came out. A salad is supposed to be cold and crisp, and usually served in its own bowl.  Our server was pretty much non-existent the entire time, but mostly because she looked weeded even though it appeared slow. We think the managers gave her too many tables outside of her main section. She was very apologetic about the salad, and offered to bring out a fresh one. We instead ordered a side of sweet potato fries for the table to share; those were alright. Our burgers were definitely good, but not good enough to have us go back anytime soon.  We've been to a couple of Red Robin's, and it's never been something to write home about, but with the average rating of this location being 2 stars, it's quite clear there's something very wrong with the way this location is being run. The only reason we went to this restaurant was because someone had bought us a gift card; if the money we spent had come out of our pocket, we would have absolutely asked to speak to a manager. This location needs a lot of help.

Rolled in for dinner around 6:45p last night and what a treat it was. Decided to go with the chain's newly revamped veggie burger but swapped the whole grain bun for a sesame seed one instead. While the speed at which it was prepared and brought out was a little long, it was worth the wait. The burger was good and that's about it - nothing outrageously special but also something I would definitely order again when I'm looking for something veg to eat. The main highlight of my experience here was my amazing waitress, Rose. She greeted us the moment we sat down and was a pleasant presence throughout the entire visit - around just enough to get what we needed but not in that annoying way that makes it seem like you can't enjoy a meal without being bothered. We had multiple refills without having to ask, fresh fries brought out within minutes of her noticing that we had run out, and a smile on her face from start to finish. What a gem and truly a pleasure to be served by. Thanks Rose!
